title.narrative: Provision of Shelter-NFI Emergency Supplies For Flood Affected Populations in South Sudan

description.narrative:
As S-NFI Pipeline agency, IOM will support the S-NFI Cluster and partners to provide frontline life-saving assistance within the immediate flood response through the provision and transportation of S-NFI in-kind supplies. IOM Pipeline will procure core S-NFI items to replenish the supplies released for flood affected people targeted by the S-NFI Cluster.
For the flood response, the S-NFI Cluster has targeted 360,000 flood-affected individuals; 159,000 of them are directly targeted through the present project. In close coordination with OCHA, the Logistics, WASH, S-NFI and FSL Clusters, IOM has released contingency WASH and S-NFI supplies from six key hubs (Juba, Bor, Rumbek, Malakal, Wau and Bentiu), to support initial responses. IOM has also allocated supplies which are currently en route to Juba to be immediately released for the next distribution planned for prioritized flood-affected locations.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Provision of Shelter-NFI Emergency Supplies For Flood Affected Populations in South Sudan

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS SOUTH SUDAN RAPID RESPONSE FLOOD 2020

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
